puppet_queues

Class DoubleLockBoundedQueue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • puppet_queues.DoubleLockBoundedQueue<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The generic type of objects contained in the queues
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProducerConsumerQueue<T>

    public class DoubleLockBoundedQueue<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of the ProducerConsumerQueue interface. (ie a FIFO thread-safe bounded queue). Uses separate locks for add and remove operations, which makes it generally more efficient than 'SingleLockBoundedQueue's.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DoubleLockBoundedQueue()
      Equivalent to DoubleLockBoundedQueue(0)
      DoubleLockBoundedQueue(int capacity)
      Creates a new bounded queue.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T dequeue()
      Dequeues the oldest item from the queue, waiting indefinitely if the queue is empty.
      T dequeue(long nanosTimeout)
      Dequeues the oldest item from the queue, with a timeout.
      void enqueue(T item)
      Enqueues a new item into the queue, waiting indefinitely if the queue is full until it can successfully carry out the operation.
      boolean enqueue(T item, long nanosTimeout)
      Enqueues a new item into the queue, with a timeout.
      int size()
      Returns the number of items currently in the queue.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DoubleLockBoundedQueue

        public DoubleLockBoundedQueue(int capacity)
        Creates a new bounded queue. A negative capacity means that the queue is unbounded.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The queue's capacity

      • DoubleLockBoundedQueue

        public DoubleLockBoundedQueue()
        Equivalent to DoubleLockBoundedQueue(0)

    • Method Detail

      • enqueue

        public boolean enqueue(T item,
                       long nanosTimeout)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ProducerConsumerQueue
        Enqueues a new item into the queue, with a timeout. Accepts a timeout (in nanoseconds) to limit the time spent waiting for the operation to succeed (in case the queue is full). In particular, calling enqueue(item, 0) allows to return immediately if the queue is full.
        Specified by:
        enqueue in interface ProducerConsumerQueue<T>
        Parameters:
        item - The item to enqueue (can't be null)
        nanosTimeout - The timeout, in nanoseconds. A strictly negative timeout means no timeout.
        Returns:
        true iff the item was successfully enqueued
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • dequeue

        public T dequeue(long nanosTimeout)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ProducerConsumerQueue
        Dequeues the oldest item from the queue, with a timeout. Accepts a timeout (in nanoseconds) to limit the time spent waiting for the operation to succeed (in case the queue is empty). In particular, calling dequeue(0) allows to return immediately if the queue is empty.
        Parameters:
        nanosTimeout - The timeout, in nanoseconds. A strictly negative timeout means no timeout.
        Returns:
        The oldest item from the queue; null iff the queue is empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • size

        public int size()
        Description copied from interface: ProducerConsumerQueue
        Returns the number of items currently in the queue.
        Returns:
        The current size of the queue.

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(T item)
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ProducerConsumerQueue
        Enqueues a new item into the queue, waiting indefinitely if the queue is full until it can successfully carry out the operation. It is the caller's responsibility to handle InterruptedException exceptions if the current thread is interrupted while waiting. Equivalent to enqueue(item, -1)
        Specified by:
        enqueue in interface ProducerConsumerQueue<T>
        Parameters:
        item - The item to enqueue (can't be null)
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • dequeue

        public T dequeue()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ProducerConsumerQueue
        Dequeues the oldest item from the queue, waiting indefinitely if the queue is empty. Same as for enqueuing operations, it is the caller's responsibility to handle InterruptedException exceptions if the current thread is interrupted while waiting. Equivalent to dequeue(-1)
        Specified by:
        dequeue in interface ProducerConsumerQueue<T>
        Returns:
        The oldest item from the queue
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
